elements.2211.03001_48bfbc44c2c7721d4b3fced2bca2a: Virtual Reality is increasingly being used for both entertainment and collaboration
elements.2211.03001_9fd982ad65f89f1b035724a22a7e7: Increasingly, there is a demand for tools that can support virtual office environments
elements.2211.03001_7565b4dcd0afeba5e9e11884f7905: Many of these technologies focus on the importance of remote collaboration, but overlook one of the most essential tasks of office work, reading
elements.2211.03001_65cc4ca1e1695f736be235f77b47d: Reading is essential for knowledge workers and will continue to be crucial even when co-workers want to share documents in a virtual office
elements.2211.03001_2c3528eb69d76440bd836e4a55476: As we look forward to a future of an immersive infinitely collaborative virtual office space, we cannot ignore the importance of a seamless reading experience being part of this virtual environment
elements.2211.03001_da1856d7e6ff2e4d1c59a7bb35697: Currently, reading in VR is considered difficult if not impossible in a sustainable way
elements.2211.03001_9429ca94c141050fbea5958a99d81: Users typically refer to many hardware-related issues with respect to the current displays which are unable to satisfy the fastidious requirements of the human visual system, including high pixel density, a large number of pixels, wide field-of-view (FOV), and a high refresh rate
elements.2211.03001_cdd47f8408ced5191ca156964c384: At the same time, recent developments including near-eye display optics, accommodation-supporting near-eye displays, foveated displays, and vision-correcting near-eye displays
elements.2211.03001_cee1c2525bb4017feb4bdc9153c5a: can alleviate some of these problems
elements.2211.03001_5084d354968f3a65c8bc2a3247a36: It is expected that VR headsets will continue to improve in terms of display technologies and pixel resolution
elements.2211.03001_4e9cd39d520b6d5503662cc310387: It is also notable that, in addition to displays, other technologies such as eye tracking are being integrated as a standard feature in forthcoming HMDs
elements.2211.03001_31addedf440fdbfd12b937d347311: Even with expected improvements in headset hardware, software tools for facilitating tasks will be equally important to promote seamless and sustainable productivity
elements.2211.03001_a7c2a1c55a2825e02c6f99dec14cc: From our observational study, we have identified two major areas of improvement for VR reading tools:
elements.2211.03001_85c248682ca7d885c02e986e95db8: that facilitate selecting a document from the immersive environment and positioning it for the best reading experience and
elements.2211.03001_304a198b78971fd81244663fd793a: that allow users to read documents without physically leaning toward the document or manually grabbing and zooming in order to read.
elements.2211.03001_00c52a7bb7845cde22d332bb8b6b6: Our main contributions are a set of three gaze-based interaction methods that can improve the reading experiences in VR: Gaze Select-and-Snap, Gaze MagGlass, and Gaze Scroll
elements.2211.03001_a46950384f6fb69ab370f7d560b2e: Our tools are general and do not make any assumptions about the underlying task
elements.2211.03001_d90c6075ee91552631472f5e2929c: We use standard interfaces for object manipulation along with eye tracking capabilities available in current HMDs
elements.2211.03001_088fa47fc242bceddcefb607592b0: We first conducted a formative study to evaluate current user pain points that might impact document manipulation and reading in VR using object manipulation and canvas interaction tasks (Section 3.1)
elements.2211.03001_f8e2de2db44ebad1125831c32c9a7: Based on this study, we identified three main challenges: difficulty positioning document objects, poor readability in current headsets, and arm fatigue (
elements.2211.03001_48f056f27ad65a823ae6d739df448: To overcome these issues, we use three interaction methods: Gaze Select-and-Snap, Gaze MagGlass, and Gaze Scroll (Section 3.2)
elements.2211.03001_2f5c40afb09d2b09b61f2e5d620a4: All these interaction methods are based on eye tracking and eliminate the need to hold controllers or perform repetitive arm gestures, both of which can be tiring in long-term interactions
elements.2211.03001_fd8ddfd354157e4f5690ad9d33d52: With Gaze Select-and-Snap, a user can simply gaze at a virtual object tagged as a document to select it and uses a single button confirmation to bring that object into a reading view
elements.2211.03001_a610ff16296a6287c4ed36b06dbb9: In the reading view, Gaze MagGlass tracks the user's eye movement and locally magnifies the text the user is reading
elements.2211.03001_e0ef3dac1f02b1bfa022a86230dfc: Finally, when the user reaches the end of a section or page, Gaze Scroll enables the document to scroll automatically enabling seamless continued reading
elements.2211.03001_0fdb63ba922be2bdd0c439f2a6799: We performed user studies to evaluate our interaction tools on two tasks: reading multiple short documents and reading a long document (Section 4)
elements.2211.03001_3192312820d7f4e6d1291cc708b4a: We measured tool usage, reading task completion time, and reading comprehension for both scenarios
elements.2211.03001_145e94f260c5a818a9b50d62a5faf: We then performed subjective evaluations to measure usability, effectiveness, workload, and preference using SUS and Raw TLX questionnaires
elements.2211.03001_918adf875cffc1245bfbf400b3916: We confirmed that our tools did not increase motion sickness using the SSQ instrument for VR sickness
elements.2211.03001_eb369cd641d0aea128e611e959c80: We observed statistically significant results that indicate that VRDoc is a more usable, less demanding, and preferred interaction method for reading in VR (Section 5)
elements.2211.03001_36f2de11842968ced8c6f98c16bbf: Identifying current user pain points for VR reading experiences.
elements.2211.03001_5be2fd67f0b4863752118116427e4: Developing three gaze-based user interactions to improve the VR reading experience: Gaze Select-and-Snap, Gaze MagGlass, and Gaze Scroll.
elements.2211.03001_e26324bda0d6622e9c90673ba7698: Evaluating these VRDoc tools on two VR document reading tasks and observing statistically significant results for reading comprehension, task completion, usability and workload, as well as readability, efficiency, and preference.
elements.2211.03001_084f7e3478d8a1c041ecb6a53ed2f: In this section, we briefly survey prior work in gaze-based interaction, text presentations in VR systems, and reading experiences in VR, AR, and MR systems.
elements.2211.03001_3d9553ddfc72ba0cf878065140c0b: Investigating text presentation on electronic devices to facilitate legibility has been an important issue for decades
elements.2211.03001_8fc7a3eba993bcc1e94fbc619423d: Text presentations in virtual environments present different issues than 2D monitor displays due to resolution limits and the presence of a third dimension in which to place documents
elements.2211.03001_91ab1e4d228368ddb109c76d036f8: Dittrich et al. proposed a set of rules for text visualizations in 3D virtual environments
elements.2211.03001_88314e5812d0a1b99184412805ba7: Their suggestions include having texts enlarged more than those on a 2D display
elements.2211.03001_b6538fdc9ed7d812a88973183542d: Jankowski et al. integrated text with video and 3D graphics to investigate the effects of text drawing style, image polarity, and background style (whether the background is a video or 3D)
elements.2211.03001_63a34bf56621b61276046c5a53ff7: The results indicated that negative presentation of texts, such as white texts on a black background, performed better in terms of accuracy than positive presentation
elements.2211.03001_acdbd18365467810695168143ac7d: Also, the billboard drawing styles, and the semitransparent white and black panels, led to a faster reading time and higher accuracy
elements.2211.03001_932ddeb7a53ffe71b78a496222f9d: Recently, Dingler et al. investigated user interface designs for displaying texts for VR reading
elements.2211.03001_c38370bd022b260db0d6b30939391: They were able to identify a set of parameters such as text size, convergence, and color for an optimal text presentation
elements.2211.03001_616eac3b53df275311baa71b6633e: The findings indicated that users preferred texts presented with a sans-serif font and a negative presentation, that is, either having white text on a black background or having black text on a white background
elements.2211.03001_4942b44f3d853ab06b1e2bf72540d: There have also been efforts to investigate text presentations on 3D objects with various surfaces
elements.2211.03001_66b771661798ae9a7066012ae9fd8: It was found that a text is easier to read when it is warped around a 3D object with a single axis instead of two axes
elements.2211.03001_72fb18ed6586bdc6e24052588b733: Detailed design recommendations on the field of view and text boxes were presented
elements.2211.03001_bdf1d86abc1ccc7af0a3d0e9747f1: While text representation is a fundamental issue for reading in VR, it should be noted that users are given the freedom to interact with texts in an infinite margin space, not a restricted 2D display
elements.2211.03001_7d4ca811da16f7f61a49be2ddb306: Our paper focuses on the interaction aspect to improve users' reading performance.
elements.2211.03001_22d085363179dba5f29181a6841c8: Reading performance depends on the devices used to display reading materials
elements.2211.03001_4df8aee5efab3a65fd575746342fe: People read slower and less accurately from computer screens than from paper
elements.2211.03001_980332cf76c097f5028136ffbf438: , although recently the difference has been diminishing
elements.2211.03001_a97b6a2ee52ef5534a22606384466: Reading performances on tablets and paper have also been extensively compared
elements.2211.03001_f2094e6d7b62e03ac53b6807fce19: compared the speed and accuracy of reading in VR and AR environments with reading on an LCD monitor
elements.2211.03001_cefe58958348707dca6fcb5534ebb: The authors also compared the reading performance on two VR HMDs that differed in display quality but were otherwise similar in every way
elements.2211.03001_c353843df05f68664f83f39463754: The results indicated that users read at a slower speed with VR and AR compared with a computer screen and had a tendency to respond more accurately and faster when wearing a VR HMD of a higher pixel density
elements.2211.03001_43d7239d05bd13236a7291f0a3108: When reading in immersive reality systems such as VR or MR, users are given more methods to interact with documents
elements.2211.03001_a83b3951c9f343d1fbd169cd80065: Here, various aspects of the hardware are considered, including the presentation of the document in the VR/MR headset and the type of user input (e.g., gestures, controllers)
elements.2211.03001_b904e285f36a8a9d304cb2ca20a69: Rzayeve et al. studied the problem of optimal text presentation type and location
elements.2211.03001_19b55ac050873aa994c7242482f93: They tested the difference in user reading experience between using the Rapid Serial Visual Presentation (RSVP) method and presenting in a paragraph
elements.2211.03001_28a6d2c1ae5316a71257dcf370e1e: In terms of location, the study tested world-fixed, head-fixed, and edge-fixed 2D windows
elements.2211.03001_1d7e68d8d0e57828084d92c049fd4: They found that RSVP is effective for reading short texts when paired with edge-fixed or head-fixed locations, and a full-paragraph presentation works well with world-fixed or edge-fixed locations when minimal movement is required for the user.
elements.2211.03001_79f144af7e984db4937666fad1e2f: For reading with MR systems, Li et al. evaluated a mixed reality experience where users read physical paper documents while seeing related artifacts such as sticky notes, figures, and videos in MR through HoloLens
elements.2211.03001_d4f8858884e021530625753a6855b: While the study identified that readers preferred this experience to that of reading on paper, laptop, or mobile devices, this did not test or improve reading in the immersive system but showed that users enjoyed seeing ancillary material in the infinite margins surrounding documents
elements.2211.03001_1c214299b6583aa8d836a6703c12d: Pianzola et al. investigated whether reading fiction in VR, having an immersive background, and having the ability to move your head to view texts with different orientations, affect users' absorption in the story
elements.2211.03001_dd6a4b823c14f4e13cd781964c063: The results show that VR enhanced users' intention to read and their affective empathy
elements.2211.03001_d9333c04b07f677479fc4dcbbc38c: These findings indicate that VR can be effectively exploited to promote reading in VR.
elements.2211.03001_364cdc95a42182abb8b555e328536: In recent years, the interest in gaze-based interactions has surged as consumer-level eye tracking sensors have been introduced to the general public
elements.2211.03001_e31067fde7fa63f85dc1b52893c56: Eye tracking technology is especially well-utilized for interactions in immersive technologies such as VR and AR
elements.2211.03001_09a0ee274492a708f6e31c8ad1de4: Tanriverdi and Jacob found that in a VR setting, selection with eyes showed a similar speed advantage when compared to 3D motion-tracked pointers
elements.2211.03001_14f64946b942420cab4b3e529775e: Piumsomboon et al. developed a set of selection methods using natural eye movements and found that such eye gaze-based interactions could improve usersâ experience while maintaining performance comparable to standard interaction techniques
elements.2211.03001_de3dee142d1f583ae921d7a08c8a1: While gaze offers fast pointing, its lack of precision and difficulty of selection confirmation has been challenging
elements.2211.03001_9e57bedd29ccda8d5a490e02deb49: To overcome this issue, researchers combined gaze input for selection and hands for manipulation
elements.2211.03001_84a86a7aece756e34afcabfb1fe5a: In this context, Pfeuffer et al. proposed a novel method, Gaze-touch, in which users use multi-touch gestures on interactive surfaces to control gaze-selected targets
elements.2211.03001_53b1b5a85a51cbccee0308f435ff0: Yu et al. further incorporated gaze and hand inputs for a full 3D object manipulation in VR
elements.2211.03001_b36a8b97dc8fc50ffd6c18987ce34: Biener et al. combined touch-based interactions with gaze for editing presentation slides in VR
elements.2211.03001_b08aa9dcbad97ccd648e40ff08e8f: With a wide variety of options for utilizing gaze for interactions, it is important to select operations for which eye-tracking can play a big role so that it efficiently supplements conventional hand- or controller-based interaction methods.
elements.2211.03001_36e6c01af64f20c2e723cfc3506a6: In this study, we investigate how existing conventional methods are used when reading documents, identify the drawbacks and needs of the user, and build an enhanced interaction method designed for reading documents in a virtual environment.
elements.2211.03001_0f35ab751890cbcb6fc2f1694105e: Reading documents in a virtual reality typically involves reading a 2D document placed in a window in a 3D virtual world
elements.2211.03001_e3218e37c74d55ae3da70edfda261: This is different from usersâ experience of reading in 2D displays, as document windows can be positioned at various depths and orientations
elements.2211.03001_d5d312fc557b3d5891a2db4436e16: This gap might cause discomfort and inconvenience in terms of VR reading, resulting in users being reluctant to attempt this activity on a VR platform
elements.2211.03001_549cd7dafafd951d1c15c2b45bc2e: Since prior work has found that users did not prefer head-fixed presentation when reading a paragraph of texts in VR
elements.2211.03001_7f620d9bed77989e145f8564c1a00: our goal was to study and develop tools that allow the reader to move freely in VR, select and attach/detach documents to a reading frame easily and enhance readability
elements.2211.03001_ba06b21a6ab49a4a52b82edc2630d: We envisioned a scenario where readers might encounter multiple documents, both long and short, in VR and that users would need to select and deselect these documents to read them
elements.2211.03001_7b6f429bbd5fb3cb3cf0b0adcd3ff: Whereas previous works have mostly focused on short paragraphs (approximately 100 words) with a uniform font size
elements.2211.03001_5592fdc330e4dfd98ebf8d3363eb5: we instead chose to observe users' reading behavior with longer documents with different font sizes for structure
elements.2211.03001_5d949f9da53e461a35360c8fc50e4: Based on observations from our formative study, we identified user pain points for this task using current interaction techniques.
elements.2211.03001_e166eca53785104c2847f6f469321: The goal of our formative study was to identify user pain points for reading in VR from selection to reading completion with currently available tools
elements.2211.03001_7734b0e5df3dadfa0e24f5450a316: We observed eight users interacting with six documents of varying lengths using available VR interaction techniques.
elements.2211.03001_e933bb117d24fa81c9a7874989d90: Users wore a state-of-the-art VR Headset and were provided with a set of interaction tools that are commonly used across VR platforms for object manipulation and 2D canvas interaction (as surveyed in Section 2)
elements.2211.03001_36adf8d2ff43b566848b96bd060f4: Manipulation was done using the HTC Vive controller
elements.2211.03001_880e960b4765c8e2b89f2f40d7edb: We first asked users to select document windows and make translation movements at distance using a "laser-pointer" raycasting method
elements.2211.03001_13c8fa7ab263569f6ddf94f44d25f: When a VR controller button is pressed by the user, a laser, or a ray cast, is projected in the direction to which the user is pointing, and the first colliding object in the virtual world is selected
elements.2211.03001_be27c631d9e187312bddf9f1711ff: Users can also make translation movements by moving the controller while pressing the dedicated button
elements.2211.03001_95b9a7a46cf74a0ea839ebc772cfe: For 6DOF manipulation, we use a method where users can
elements.2211.03001_c67a901a3df70c0a6394d4df69eac: grabâ' and move or rotate 2D windows, which is also a common object manipulation method
elements.2211.03001_e85dc399bba264f4c39692b80f3a6: Here, when a direct collision is detected between the VR controller and a 2D document window while the assigned button is pressed, the object follows the motion of the controller
elements.2211.03001_d119d7305b74609592224fee62b1d: An example is depicted in Figure.
elements.2211.03001_4509e2edb102fa4a3b199037b4332: Based on these interactions, users can manipulate the 2D document windows that are at various orientations.
elements.2211.03001_8ff4697a770731ac4caa04b038b8d: We recruited eight participants (three females, five males)
elements.2211.03001_ef25f2a8b87ff38876b0609c70c9b: Three had previous experience in VR but not in reading texts in VR
elements.2211.03001_e27157cb7ca3de758f10defb7cf9e: Participants wore an HTC Vive Pro Eye
elements.2211.03001_5c9d20ef2fda8fb48de008a3a7b14: for the VR HMD, which has
elements.2211.03001_8348b3463c1411cb8414d169e595f: It also provides eye tracking capabilities
elements.2211.03001_793729a4e1d21e90dc61eb79cf80e: Participants start from a fixed position with six documents placed in front of them as seen in Fig.
elements.2211.03001_20f52573fdcea58fed04bb17eeb31: The documents were placed such that they formed a semicircle around the userâs starting position
elements.2211.03001_21c3f9df2353341e5686f15ddd9dc: Four of the documents were short passages with about
elements.2211.03001_acb957289a8ae8b9fa4f1eb1a111a: words, while the other two were long passages with about
elements.2211.03001_bc5ac16f4de40531ebf332ec062de: , the VR text presentation guideline by having a black background color and white text color for all documents
elements.2211.03001_d2c0ebce1138d1dbe5949cb798541: All six documents had the same canvas size, requiring the long documents to have scroll-able windows
elements.2211.03001_b8020b26775980f4e571fa3388f72: The participants were able to scroll by selecting a document and moving their fingers vertically on the VR controller trackpad
elements.2211.03001_440b98de9556460aec64a2c14f5b8: minutes to freely read all six documents without any specific order
elements.2211.03001_4f17610ccfcc000efc86a01630d84: We followed the experience with a semi-constructed interview
elements.2211.03001_32a7acd6c54239d22607d36ae1080: The questions focused on the general experience of reading in VR, satisfaction with current interaction techniques, and desired user features.
elements.2211.03001_b867979072d56a82d62a7b1169067: Through observing usersâ behavior and collecting feedback through an interview, we were able to identify the following user pain points.
elements.2211.03001_bb83469c33f1bb534e3d59687c23d: When selecting a document, it took participants multiple attempts to re-orient the document window into the desired position
elements.2211.03001_16df9789b6016f4f26b51a4c52281: Unlike general object manipulation, participants tended to have a preferred distance and orientation (upright) for reading
elements.2211.03001_3d2f3a4f27efb2c0aaa18ffe63a54: Six participants noted that positioning the document to this preferred location and orientation took more time than expected
elements.2211.03001_91bdf341fd09037af87d472638a43: ââ All eight participants mentioned that switching their attention between multiple documents made them more aware of this inconvenience
elements.2211.03001_2a27ad0739f997e8887d4d916a335: Five participants brought up the need to automate the positioning procedure as they already knew how they wanted the document of interest to be oriented: up right in front of their head position.
elements.2211.03001_61fcd99fa37925f5c6154821cfa7d: All eight participants reported that document readability was poor due to its resolution and distortion
elements.2211.03001_0c8772a177b0796d43c696800ccc9: P2 and P5 commonly mentioned that when reading on a 2D display, they were even able to read texts sideways, but with the VR headset the text appeared blurry and this was not possible
elements.2211.03001_ad3da626c7423111605e3673706bd: Five participants noted that unless the document was perfectly upright, the slant created a distortion that decreased readability
elements.2211.03001_7d71c633c4b632e6d5a9ebb11060b: We observed that participants positioned the documents with smaller font sizes closer, effectively magnifying the font, to enhance readability.
elements.2211.03001_18b1ad9b227acd9a2d60f3b2fb859: minute trial, participants tended to hold the VR controller up constantly to interact with the documents
elements.2211.03001_fdf3c6bf3779d41f75181cd96852e: This behavior was consistently observed even when users were using the controller's trackpad for scrolling since the rest of the interactions, such as selecting and moving the document, required the user to hold up the physical device
elements.2211.03001_64d3969d5f5567897db1383afaa59: Four of the participants reported arm fatigue which is a known issue ("Gorilla Arm") for gesture-based interactions
elements.2211.03001_1737076a8ab8fd33696943c399c68: This is exacerbated by the additional weight of the controller when compared to watch-based gesture interactions
elements.2211.03001_d2652cf665c98e4ef47b731fd3195: Such issues of fatigue would likely increase in longer VR experiences.
elements.2211.03001_bfece074849ff71305a57208abc32: Based on this formative study, we developed tools specifically to address positioning, readability, and arm fatigue.
elements.2211.03001_29f3251187c5bde3f182c2b36d9ed: To address user pain points we developed three new tools: Gaze Select-and-Snap, Gaze MagGlass, and Gaze Scroll, which we collectively refer to as VRDoc, tools for better document reading in VR
elements.2211.03001_b9080867358ad51981d3f48529ef8: This section describes our design process from user needs to potential solutions
elements.2211.03001_0ebb196436b7713aa885685bb01e5: Focused on the pain points of positioning, readability, and arm fatigue, our design thinking progressed as follows:
elements.2211.03001_dc94db19326dbb9d99f0b84bb8aca: Users do not seem to require or desire as much object manipulation freedom when reading documents
elements.2211.03001_d5ec590a31036c4c8418cd92e107c: Given the user tendency for a specific positioning with respect to documents, we should automate and simplify moving the document to a near-optimal position once selected
elements.2211.03001_0edefc5eb22e7b1a4a2d0b6c731eb: Automatically positioning the document in an upright non-skewed position will enhance readability.
elements.2211.03001_bc0c5f85941f3605ad8ea937c433a: Users manipulated documents to effectively magnify text, but this often led to documents being positioned too close for the reader to easily contextualize their place in the document
elements.2211.03001_9116288e183e17c3ecdd71c60a6dc: A better solution would be to selectively magnify the current text the user is reading.
elements.2211.03001_f8d2af24710ab0c23c27b537052d4: VR controller use and arm gestures should be minimized
elements.2211.03001_0d3013416fe1cc0fa700c234b79e9: While some VR controller use may still be required, in a virtual office, for longer reading tasks the user should not need to use their arms at all, enabling them to set the controller down
elements.2211.03001_44becbca3f79864a25872550eb5fe: We believe this will reduce fatigue and improve the overall experience.
elements.2211.03001_508ecb07b7ef2e5fac4f080d04a20: We believed that the novel eye tracking capability of the Vive headset could be leveraged to develop solutions for some of these issues
elements.2211.03001_0e6c2d3df4db2b46ee387e92cc430: Eye-tracking is becoming increasingly available in commodity HMDs
elements.2211.03001_b7f0af5395775ade7b2c4b8c1b382: and since reading naturally evokes specific eye movements, document interactions with gaze are natural and intuitive.
elements.2211.03001_66e93f47e5e8ca60cb8f16250cc00: In our approach, we use the SDK provided by HTC Vive
elements.2211.03001_d701c6f0f9cc39837d4c554c1227b: for eye tracking calibration and data with the Unity game engine
elements.2211.03001_d969e6c230ecc7b0d62f0b732ee86: The headset provides eye tracking with an accuracy of
elements.2211.03001_959fb4bde71b7de6683f2877d7555: The infinite freedom of object manipulation in 3D was actually a negative factor in document positioning
elements.2211.03001_a21dcac46f83df0b21b15df5887e7: Documents were only readable in the upright position near the users' direct line of sight
elements.2211.03001_6205f47fb002a248d3122e00500bb: to automate the action of selecting and positioning through the user's gaze
elements.2211.03001_3fb27c72eb839e736073dbcb711fe: Prior work has established that users value the ability to select 3D objects with gaze and bring these closer to the user's hand
elements.2211.03001_231ea72fc081753418278585f3cf8: , but this is the first method designed for document objects (a virtual object that is tagged as
elements.2211.03001_4219b73dd708eeeca78812ee89524: ) that both rotates the 3D object into a specific position and snaps it into a fixed effective 2D perspective specifically for reading
elements.2211.03001_e29f8c3eab8812f4753f0987d987a: To engage Gaze Select-and-Snap, the user first directs their gaze toward the 3D document object, the gaze focus is detected and the document object is highlighted with a green stroke to visualize its selection for the user
elements.2211.03001_214010e97c96a0a53e5da0d1d7e59: With a single click of the trigger button, the 3D document object is brought forward towards the head position and snapped into an effective 2D position in front of the user
elements.2211.03001_e6c6887ffb2c66c57bb4ea0f513c8: The window is snapped parallel to the user's head position, ensuring the window stays upright
elements.2211.03001_b6be83574b70117fbaa9e1736f3e5: An example of this interaction is shown in Figure.
elements.2211.03001_60745a63e9c477b7203de3b1f166b: When multiple documents overlap, Gaze Select-and-Snap first highlights the top document, then if the top document is not selected, Gaze Select-and-Snap sequentially brings hidden documents to the forefront until the desired document is identified and selected.
elements.2211.03001_e577b53475be46a6377b7acf1fe02: To improve text readability once the document was in position, we incorporated a magnifying glass effect that is activated by users' eye movements:
elements.2211.03001_0385950dea5fecf094f22afacd78d: For low-vision computer users, video-based eye trackers have been used effectively to increase the on-screen magnification in traditional computing settings
elements.2211.03001_ddd0defe76bf63f9a19332167c1d5: , however, to the best of our knowledge, this is the first implementation of interactive selective text magnification in VR
elements.2211.03001_f19020a2117ba32f3143adb23a5b2: is only activated when (1) the user gazes at a document, (2) the document is within a certain distance (
elements.2211.03001_7a43fc08b56fd1c5c98e05985e14c: ), and (3) when the user gazes at the document window for more than
elements.2211.03001_db8a136d86ee49f8b299d1d6086d1: These robust heuristics were designed to ensure that the document in view is the specific document that the user wants to read
elements.2211.03001_3c2285abc5d04b458e62a1605b89a: When the activation conditions are met, a second virtual camera is created on the collision point of the userâs gaze and the document object
elements.2211.03001_b49b36643b85d10e36fee0b3a3614: The virtual camera is perpendicular to the document while following the userâs gaze
elements.2211.03001_39aea90ecdcd8ce22b08c059e61a1: The captured scene is rendered at a texture of a 2d plane that is rendered in front of the main camera
elements.2211.03001_2c580ee91550c9515b2860b8f3b2a: The field of view of the virtual camera and the distance from the document object are heuristically determined so that it magnifies the document by 150
elements.2211.03001_2ded96e542d13345e4c6211730d86: with a size that covers approximately
elements.2211.03001_0d5c798a23172d4435f1a2738546e: Directly applying raw gaze position data to the virtual camera causes great jittering as eye tracker data are inherently noisy and include tracking errors
elements.2211.03001_2ebec2f6c33af9fa21c4bfbb2df2a: This worsens the user experience as the jittering is visualized in a magnified way
elements.2211.03001_d13f544c1eb2cca753b6e41c4b731: To address this issue, we generally follow the saccade detection and smoothing algorithm from
elements.2211.03001_582599d11689248eacb3d2401f6fa: is calculated as a weighted mean of the set of points within a fixation window.
elements.2211.03001_a3703924cfacf77bd4de970fb3d5f: is automatically initiated when the activation conditions are met but can be manually turned on or off by the user if necessary
elements.2211.03001_874184bda518fa5d3bc2c44903f9d: Note that activation conditions and the degree of magnification were heuristically determined for the study
elements.2211.03001_25ffef27dc3554d506e7ebbd4f0e0: An example of the activation is depicted in Figure.
elements.2211.03001_5ea1dbab3a914e3f5b8c114be4c57: Since longer documents are rarely considered in VR reading studies, Gaze Scroll is the first tool designed specifically to help alleviate fatigue when reading longer documents
elements.2211.03001_f01b5403b4932ba314d7265816117: The objective of gaze scroll is to avoid the necessity of users having to re-engage with the controller after they have begun reading
elements.2211.03001_a0b8c6fd0315852bc667c5f6bdeb0: At this point, the document should be snapped into the 2D reading position and the user should be able to put the controller down
elements.2211.03001_27eaa7d5ffd25b2c2a0bec6ce46ec: To facilitate document navigation without a controller, two buttons were placed within a document each on the top and the bottom of the window, as seen in Figure
elements.2211.03001_fd5fe8acaeb004b933c97d008841c: When the user's gaze reaches the button for
elements.2211.03001_d39f2a45ac1aa2908cdf5de946cfa: seconds, the document scrolls up or down by a full sentence
elements.2211.03001_3328dd26bcd4cfe03d6a663d2dad9: Fixating the gaze on the button can increase the number of sentences
elements.2211.03001_b4a6464e688bce2f3d394342561a4: For example, if a user stares at the lower button for 2 seconds, the document scrolls down by four sentences
elements.2211.03001_9105451920c6d3e4c0ea3ab563893: This activation condition creates a controlled advancement and minimizes focal changes, which can be frequent when scrolling is rapid or uncontrolled.
elements.2211.03001_36380b7e157c4c3ee6b54e5a7c833: tools are designed to facilitate a better reading experience in VR, from automating the selection and positioning of document windows to magnifying text for readability to allowing gaze-based navigation of longer documents.
elements.2211.03001_4f33519940c6fa8407a074810cadc: After implementing our tools we conducted a series of user studies to investigate how usersâ reading experiences changed with VRDoc tools
elements.2211.03001_e37f886474cba685a206cc88deb34: We aimed to answer the following research questions through our evaluation:
elements.2211.03001_819d1ed80acd2897df899fa3463bf: Does Gaze Select-and-Snap improve document handling (positioning)?
elements.2211.03001_998fb97686617914598380561f1e2: Do VRDoc tools including Gaze Scroll for navigation lessen feelings of fatigue?
elements.2211.03001_5457ac01d2402ea2b0a5469ece97b: Overall do VRDoc tools work together to improve efficiency and usability?
elements.2211.03001_55f278f9a55426eceec14d7d30964: Do readers prefer having access to VRDoc tools when reading in VR?
elements.2211.03001_7245037ce92a9feddd8356c1f3785: We first evaluated each tool of VRDoc by comparing it to the basic object manipulation defined in Section 3.1 (henceforth,
elements.2211.03001_adf0df0a0016ffe7c64412f0fb88f: Then, we conducted a study where users were given access to all VRDoc tools versus a baseline.
elements.2211.03001_4cbffc123772ad3a6d4ecd9a40643: Thirteen participants (eight male, five female) were recruited from a convenience sample of university students for the evaluation experiment (age range
elements.2211.03001_1c005bacf0773ef11a76f5bae6fc1: Eight participants wore glasses, three wore contact lenses, and the rest did not require vision correction
elements.2211.03001_64ef9ad196d80330dc0e529b7eefb: All of our participants were proficient in English
elements.2211.03001_c8588377e725bc23e5edfcd249f42: Eight of the participants had previously experienced VR systems
elements.2211.03001_43b66f8a1ce6687c7778351f6dcdb: The experiments were set in a virtual office environment for immersion
elements.2211.03001_84faa4f4ab1ea6218a80302edae7a: The tracking area was set to

elements.2211.03001_594c9466977845893490e2e1b09f8: The texts were left-aligned and the line spacing was set to

elements.2211.03001_650cf19ac3a5edebba886ff5b44f4: to guarantee a similar difficulty level

elements.2211.03001_e8c6f5b57d6b5b505d04790d7f29f: so that they do not require scrolling and around 500 words for
elements.2211.03001_8fa4b242a3bcf2ead9adfcaaae77c: We employed within subject experiments in the order of (1) individual tool evaluation and (2) combined evaluation
elements.2211.03001_9b228cc8531b74adfa2cbc11c5950: Each of the tools of VRDoc (Gaze Select-and-Snap, Gaze MagGlass, and Gaze Scroll) was compared to baseline with separate tasks
elements.2211.03001_6d441df63efcf307e271c0c8fc15e: The order of tasks for individual tool evaluation and tool presentation (VRDoc, baseline) for all experiments was counterbalanced using Latin-square.
elements.2211.03001_d69d56d60154fceb229789b8f26b6: are placed in front of the starting position in a semicircle, as seen in Fig.

elements.2211.03001_3cb737793d6cf1259804783b01829: While taking the test, readers can choose to review any of the documents by re-selecting them to help answer the questions.

elements.2211.03001_4aa2d1d2feb74e0cd1db12fc36778: The order of the passages is random
elements.2211.03001_d706e932532e0ecae9fe2222f3b2e: The reading comprehension test consists of five questions
elements.2211.03001_8bc0da03b70bd59351e6e2c5c11d9: Readers are required to select each of the three documents to read them
elements.2211.03001_1296de0bbe8898eb7968e9815ed71: During the test, readers can choose to review any of the documents (by reselecting) them to help them answer the questions.
elements.2211.03001_09f4383c1b69ec2682b6d5b26de3a: Users are asked to solve a reading comprehension test after reading the given documents
elements.2211.03001_c14b3917359fa9453bec5c1d3ed8c: The reading comprehension test consists of fact-check, multiple-choice questions based on the given passage
elements.2211.03001_d06acb2e7598a0ac8a19ff0db13f3: Once the participant verbally determined that they were ready to take the quiz, a 2D plane containing the questions is displayed in front of the user in the VR environment
elements.2211.03001_58d8347bd9b224416fe4d53bcbbc3: The task completion time (TCT) was measured separately by
elements.2211.03001_b7270a7465e2f4d25a7e5f4e7d569: is defined as the time from the start of the trial until before reading the questions, and the
elements.2211.03001_ef2060f4fe6f0aafcf2cf2bdd292b: is the time from after reading the questions until the participant verbally determines the final answer
elements.2211.03001_b97cf4555b36c206f6b4ac655a31e: The user study was conducted in the following order: A participant was first introduced to the overview and goal of the experiment and filled out a demographic survey
elements.2211.03001_77ffeedf4079bc8c2786533d71250: Then, the participant performs each of the individual evaluation tasks in a given order, and finally the combined evaluation task
elements.2211.03001_524363a77cd9ea4514d841d3b7e13: Each task consists of two trials, one performed using our proposed method and the other using baseline
elements.2211.03001_d73e9493d42270578f36db282ded4: The order of individual evaluation tasks and the order trials for all tasks were counterbalanced among the participants using Latin-square
elements.2211.03001_32d6a7e745144f503edb96ae6968b: Prior to each trial, participants filled out a pre-SSQ
elements.2211.03001_ee2484955584aa15883eb4d61b762: survey and were given a tutorial including a five-minute training session
elements.2211.03001_74292a86d3ad8ded3add183f31db2: After each trial, participants filled out a SUS questionnaire
elements.2211.03001_39336b69bb4cc09f9dd62cffbf72a: for workload, post-SSQ for VR sickness, and a subjective evaluation questionnaire on a 5-point Likert scale for readability, effectiveness, and preference (See appendix
elements.2211.03001_6bb8779665311bcf812474dd3f496: The experimenter reminded participants to consider the interaction aspect when answering the questions
elements.2211.03001_bf1822826527dbec9ad85270ff96e: They were given an additional 5-minute break in between trials
elements.2211.03001_61ea1fce1fc1db8762f6b30da7673: Note that, before each trial, we ran HTC Vive Pro Eye's eye calibration software to ensure proper gaze tracking
elements.2211.03001_f332e68c024ebbcb18828155c8280: After each task was performed, we conducted a semi-structured interview to collect participantsâ comments and feedback
elements.2211.03001_89d7267c5957bf0f483a2a11466f3: The entire experiment lasted around 90 minutes per participant
elements.2211.03001_f9443d2605acce40dcfe91b8d4fb1: All trials performed by the participants were recorded in video files for accurate observation and evaluation
elements.2211.03001_8f6dd21751f1688554a211061a49f: In addition to TCT for all tasks, we measured the time Gaze MagGlass was activated for Task 2 and Task 4.
elements.2211.03001_d618c948a764bd7c8dcfc3de474c5: In this section, we divide the evaluation items collected during Task 1 through Task 4 into objective measures and subjective measures
elements.2211.03001_9be0095dce9fc0207d5bc9093e2df: Note that the results are not directly comparable between tasks as the reading conditions vary
elements.2211.03001_45ec6268fdaa0447b52510044b4a1: The visualized results can be found in appendix
elements.2211.03001_bf6fb388eaf12631fc2f96f1f4652: We measured Task Completion Time (TCT), the sum of reading time and solving time for all four tasks:
elements.2211.03001_214f32f75f55000390632d5ac2242: : Gaze Select-and-Snap allowed readers to complete both the reading task and the comprehension quiz faster than baseline
elements.2211.03001_1d8589d4a3575a70d64950cbb57b8: Both reading time and solving time revealed a significant difference between the two methods according the the Wilcoxon signed-rank test: reading time (
elements.2211.03001_68170407a8d192693296391d0a22c: : Readers read slightly faster with Gaze MagGlass (

elements.2211.03001_5b2248eef0fe76a2203c37aa256a7: : Gaze Scroll allowed readers to read the longer passages slightly faster than baseline, however, Gaze Scroll had a negative impact on test solving time
elements.2211.03001_734e8a12c66ccf8835fc57a2ae7d9: Nevertheless, the differences were not significant which is also reflected in TCT: Gaze Scroll (
elements.2211.03001_566e0ee2c5f6d707494900e60f133: : With VRDoc, readers have significantly faster reading time and solving time than with baseline
elements.2211.03001_cf5b39d866ddb33bebab174bbc246: ) in comprehension results in any of the four tasks between VRDoc and baseline according to the Wilcoxon signed-rank test
elements.2211.03001_e449116d0a39aef98e6243fcb3063: This was expected as (1) VRDoc tools are designed to make the reading task easier and more efficient but do not explicitly aid comprehension, and (2) readers were allowed to review the passages after reading the questions
elements.2211.03001_6abeae1efdee63ab4c0bb9ada1606: The results ensure that the participants put the same amount of effort into all tasks.
elements.2211.03001_dd20be0d3a26fdd7a552800ec7726: For Task 2, Gaze MagGlass was activated in an average of 51.72
elements.2211.03001_2a68012fa48c11a77f33d2f760dc4: With Task 4, where all of the tools are integrated, Gaze MagGlass was activated in an average of 67.18
elements.2211.03001_b033cc080bfc4eb20dfa572454e7e: We measured the usability of the methods by calculating the SUS scores.

elements.2211.03001_4e2723d68d803ba62560381b43660: For all four tasks, our proposed method had significantly lower RTLX scores than the baseline according to Wilcoxon signed-rank test.

elements.2211.03001_8f411231aa62be798be7218a8c45b: In this section, we analyze and discuss our findings on the quantitative results and post-experiment interviews by revisiting our research questions in Section 4.
elements.2211.03001_a8df887fbab4edc3541cb2e013572: Gaze Select-and-Snap showed the most promising and excellent results among the three VRDoc tools
elements.2211.03001_b45b77d4a1c907c1f7d0e1f10dc31: We were able to observe readers significantly reducing time in selecting and reading document-of-interest out of multiple documents
elements.2211.03001_3327baf64e76de421e2112878b38c: Three participants commented that they enjoyed using Gaze Select-and-Snap not only for bringing documents up front to read but to move around multiple documents quickly
elements.2211.03001_5ace66c2428254cac7ded5eea4ce3: I found it easier to scatter documents around with my gaze rather than holding up the controller and swaying my arm constantly
elements.2211.03001_5e61e284142993c3f9954ea379a79: I could just look somewhere else to move away documents
elements.2211.03001_d5ce509092782e52398b11bcc5ab3: P5 and P11 commonly mentioned how with a larger VR space, they would find Gaze Select-and-Snap even more useful to find and orient document windows
elements.2211.03001_5177aecce66914d558542c6510457: Although we cannot make direct comparisons between tasks since the conditions differ, when using baseline, the results in workload show that overall usersâ perceived workload was higher with multiple short passages (Task 1) than with longer passages (Task 3)
elements.2211.03001_98799b0dbc6ff8acdada0157b833e: Implying that reading multiple documents was more demanding than reading a single long document as it involved frequently re-orienting document windows
elements.2211.03001_8c9a98d5c5fba26a1801150bd5377: This further strengthens the usability of Gaze Select-and-Snap, and how much positioning is important in reading documents in VR settings.
elements.2211.03001_eaf823c304f9e9827aa871ffddd14: The quantitative results of the `readability' prove that Gaze MagGlass successfully enhances users' perceived readability when reading in VR
elements.2211.03001_dbb69c5375dda6fe8aedac6ac9186: Gaze MagGlass was the only feature that had an on/off option, since, even in a real-world scenario, we do not require magnification glasses at all times
elements.2211.03001_27d5f9c9ce69730aff687a50dcd63: For Task 2 and Task 4, we were able to observe that Gaze MagGlass was activated for more than half of the time
elements.2211.03001_228b0684ff8607701995db0a33c5e: This means that this is a necessary feature for reading in VR that will likely be used
elements.2211.03001_7898b90746ddcc201a987398362fa: When participants were only provided with the baseline, they often moved their position to better read the passage or reached out to grab the document and manually move the document towards them
elements.2211.03001_479d4874d0295841ac01610368ccc: Six participants commented that they anticipate this feature to be utilized when reading documents with a more complex structure such as paragraphs with varying fonts or multi-column documents
elements.2211.03001_f5bc7d735df805feafc25f8d2621f: Five of the participants mentioned how when used with Gaze Scroll in Task 4, Gaze MagGlass helped in keeping track of where they are in the document.
elements.2211.03001_3319556ddc119c3e9efa5c58f3530: Gaze Scroll on Reducing Feelings of Fatigue
elements.2211.03001_7147fcbd58e3b233a9ed7b9a3f15e: Gaze Scroll showed promising results in the measured participants' subjective perception, yet there were some mixed reviews
elements.2211.03001_f69b82dab5e11e58464d7857d5a96: Four participants commented that Gaze Scroll was convenient in the initial reading phase since the buttons were naturally placed at the end of the reader's gaze
elements.2211.03001_e65d3bcb2dcbfd8b84b8b66ecacc1: However, during the reading comprehension test phase, when the reader had to come back to the passage to look for information, they would prefer to use the controller since it was easier to quickly navigate to the top or bottom of the page
elements.2211.03001_c340cabd757ddad03df994292ac3f: This implies that, for actual implementation, it would be a meaningful approach to integrate the existing trackpad-scrolling with Gaze Scroll to enhance users' reading experience
elements.2211.03001_afa2d3878e762d9b4561ceb73eb29: In terms of fatigue, the SSQ results did not reveal a significant difference in fatigue when compared with the baseline
elements.2211.03001_23481100562e2f7c873a13daf3af3: This may be because in the experiment setting, readers were not required to go through documents for hours as much as we do in our daily lives
elements.2211.03001_8326c664b565c5b540b71edbe1e0c: However, Gaze Scroll is proved to be effective in reducing perceived workload as it showed significantly smaller TLX scores compared to the baseline.
elements.2211.03001_3fddefb357b4637c311ee367a24d9: Usability, Efficiency, and Preference of VRDoc
elements.2211.03001_e98bb51cc3bc06b1eeea7b4a5be99: Subjective measures proved that individually, readers had a positive experience with each of the tools
elements.2211.03001_78e6afa31e40234552efc2e7ab442: When combined, we are able to see that all three subjective measures; effectiveness, readability, and preference were higher than the individual scores of each tool
elements.2211.03001_d44a612458d39003458a17458952b: This implies that with the three tools combined, the tools form a synergy effect
elements.2211.03001_0f3a6788c3784f03e6f02cf263784: As shown in the results, with VRDoc, users stated that they perceived improved readability for both long passages and short passages
elements.2211.03001_68674f2e5deca9e10dcf48d8995eb: We observe a similar conclusion with respect to how efficient the methods were in assisting users' reading experience
elements.2211.03001_8c43494336a767c0a1cc50c49916b: All these led to VRDoc having a significantly higher preference
elements.2211.03001_11387cc8c47d39112c565ad7bdad1: Eight of the participants collectively mentioned how VRDoc presented a new possibility in reading in VR, which is what they have not imagined before
elements.2211.03001_750ca601f1878dde02e62dc024971: ââ Five participants pointed out that reader-specific interactions are essential in the virtual environment, and the lack of them prevents them from even attempting to read long texts in a VR setup
elements.2211.03001_ffc5a42353e7087e9ccd2c3d66e78: Hence, for real-world applications, developers should consider providing readers in VR with a set of tools that tackle pain points to maximize users' performance.
elements.2211.03001_55cf4d62b5caf085a41d99bc9bfa1: We present VRDoc, a set of three gaze-based interactions that improve usersâ reading experience in VR
elements.2211.03001_5830fb453a0fb6c29b0ba067899d1: Through a formative study, we identified major issues users face when reading documents with conventional object manipulation methods in a VR setting.
elements.2211.03001_9c679ec1ec8ffcefee31ea814e8cf: We utilize eye-tracking as a solution to streamline basic interactions for usersâ convenience while minimizing the need to continuously hold up a VR controller
elements.2211.03001_632befbb6c5dc229c3ec85865bdb9: VRDoc consists of three gaze-based interactions that each addresses the aforementioned problems:
elements.2211.03001_d4a15342f8b347efc55e05e03aca3: for selecting and positioning document windows,
elements.2211.03001_6c8e11dab318e5adcd6df7f01d6fb: for improving readability through magnification, and
elements.2211.03001_28b989f5fc9fe5f24e31e31ab5c4b: for scrolling long documents with gaze
elements.2211.03001_431b16cf1e229dd9966f42e511ff2: We evaluated our method through a series of reading tasks
elements.2211.03001_4f5769442f2f474d2bd29f96aa883: and overall results indicated that the combined VRDoc tools significantly improve participantsâ performance speed, usability with less workload when compared to using conventional methods.
elements.2211.03001_1da693e1ef0f8075237882c591b60: Our study offers insights on how gaze-based interactions could assist VR reading interfaces
elements.2211.03001_dbf377975c28179b6ffaf45d4976b: Our current approach assumes that good eye tracking capabilities are available in the VR system
elements.2211.03001_3e75d09625ee9d32cc37955d3c749: Since participantsâ performances are highly governed by the experiment settings, further investigation is needed to evaluate VRDoc in general applications corresponding to virtual offices or remote collaboration
elements.2211.03001_3103d06ec451edf4cb31c72eb181f: The detailed setting used for VRDoc were all empirically determined for our study
elements.2211.03001_df1d3cf6ade294188854cbf2e35ad: Further research should be conducted to investigate the optimal distance to place document windows for Gaze Select-and-Snap, the degree of magnification and size of canvas for Gaze MagGlass, and the placement of buttons and activation conditions for Gaze Scroll
elements.2211.03001_41039650be369c218ae02122f2d95: The experiment setting used in our approach assumed minimal movement from the participants
elements.2211.03001_8f8e8440541c114b8e8546acbfb7b: It is anticipated that there will be a different set of interactions that users would need assistance with when VR locomotion is considered
elements.2211.03001_286a580aa8d889dfffea4e4894542: Our current study follows the guidelines on how to present texts in VR
elements.2211.03001_7cf8ef689b8beda4aae62504649fd: However, these guidelines might not always be applicable when we read documents with complex layouts or structures, such as academic papers with two columns or documents with multimedia resources
elements.2211.03001_c28f4d86606615be067ca62629d37: Similar to recent efforts on identifying the optimal format for reading in mobile phones
elements.2211.03001_1ebf252a30db71ce3835229472847: , it would be worth investigating a detailed format of how the structures should be converted for optimal reading experiences in VR
elements.2211.03001_873322754e35a26ec4f1f514413ab: Going beyond simply consuming documents, it is notable that VR offers a possibility of a
elements.2211.03001_fa57eea950fa43e035d4616209896: For our future work, we aim to investigate collaborative interactions when multiple users read, share and discuss documents
elements.2211.03001_e1a979ffa79b6a43ce7f7bb7ade58: The findings can be adapted to various multi-user applications such as virtual classrooms and virtual conferences
elements.2211.03001_901ff325c410aa950ab70355d6339: As new display technologies and headsets are developed to deal with the challenging issues related to pixel density, pixel resolution, field-of-view, refresh rate and distortion, it would be useful to evaluate their impact on VR reading experiences.
